i have read a lot of discussion about smoking being a factor for develop lung cancer and also not being one and their thought towards it i agree that smoking for the most part is not the wise of idea if your wanting to lead a healthy life i do not agree with the fact that it cause it since i know too many people that have smoke many year and never develop lung cancer i believe that it is cause from a breakdown in the immune system where essential vitamin are lose or need and of course gene that are pas down to we it seem by now that they could detect these gene and also give something to people especially over the age of 50 to strengthen the immune system and make good cell strong to fight the bad cell that spread cancer my mom do develop lung cancer and do smoke so she do fall under that stereotype of lung cancer but there are very many that never have without cigarette my mom would of been miserable in her later day because that is all she have since she wa a widow by 7 year when she past away and they comfort she and relax she and she enjoy it very much by the way she have degenerative bone disease since her early twenty and have always suffer with bone pain for many year she also become diabetic in her 50 so i have to think that just possibly the cancer come from some of those factor since i see a lot of people have diabete and then cancer i have read an article about cancer and it state that cancer cell love sugar so you should really watch your sugar intake i am glad my mom have her cigarette because they were like a good friend to she and she would of been miserable without in her final month so i do not blame she for that at all or the cigarette a i mention too many people who do not smoke or drink develop cancer a my mother in law even do and die at the age of 53 like her father who do not smoke and it wa determined that it wa an aggressive genetic cancer now we have to worry about my husband and our child whom it would not matter what they do because his mom eat very healthy and do not have bad habit i guess my message is that you should do what make you happy and try to limit some of the bad of course but just be comfortable in what you are do because life can be too short to do without and my mom die do what she love and i would not have it any other way and good for she we love you mom i think you should just do what ever make you feel good because in the end it would not matter because what go to happen will happen and that is that it is aggravating but i really am start to believe 100 in that i also do not like the way people who develop lung cancer are treat by some and especially doctor do not blame yourself for this disease just because it is call lung cancer my heart go out to all of you suffer with this disease good luck and good wish for success

hello everybody yeah i know i have not been here in a very loooong time i have been real occupy lately i am grade 2 stage 2 1 b hcv positive i go through tx last yr for around a year after i go to 0 from 2 7 mil vl i spike south and my vl begin to rise so i wa take off of tx now i am consider a non responder i start have upper retweet quadrant pain maybe 3 to 4 month ago it is a very uncomfortable feeling hard to explain my gp order an ultrasound which reveal a lesion on my gallbladder then i have to be clear by my lung specialist copd and liver specialist to get the gallbladder remove ok i go through that b get ready for surgery go to surgeon surgeon say we do not know if the spot on your gallbladder is a lesion or not we may just wait to see what the liver dr recommend maybe tx before surgery meanwhile my liver dr order a fast ultrasound that show thing up real good find out that i have and 11 mm cyst on my liver am tell that this is pretty big consider anything over 2 mm is big laugh out loud also reveal liver inflammation and raise vl dk vl it is the holiday and of course the medical world seem to stand still until the middle of jan here in indiana i am wait to hear from my hepatologist about tx wonder if anyone else have have liver cyst of this size i am think that this and the inflame liver are the cause for the pain and the mystery gallbladder thingy do anyone have any suggestion to get this do quick i am in pain and just want this over with thank you for all reply rudy

i have struggle with write this for a while now a i know the word i am about to say were go to come a a shock and potentially frighten some of you and fir this i am so sorry and i debate not share at all but i find strength in our group and i really need it right now i apologize in advance for the stress and anxiety this might cause any of you go through treatment a i know whenever i would read a post like this it would send i into a tailspin we go in for tony 18 month check up last month a most of you know because i ask for prayer for great result however on 13 of january his normal blood count for the white and neutrophil were low than they usually are having just get over a about of horrible stomach flu his doctor attribute it to recover from the virus the lab were still in normal range they were just low for tony normal and so we wrap up the appointment disappoint but not super concerned a his doctor wa not concern and everything wa still in normal limit in fact his most recent chimerism analysis show that he wa still full donor we were not comfortable with the result and so we request come back in 2 week and two week later the count are still low the doctor offer to ease our mind and just have a bone marrow that day for definitive result but we opt to wait one more week bc there wa a ton of these lgl reactive lymph in the blood indicative of a viral or tcell response also later that day we were go to find out if the ivf treatment and embryo transfer wa successful or not and were to find out if i wa pregnant we do not want that overshadow by wait for marrow result we do decide to have a chimerism run just to make sure that everything wa still good and we get a call that his have drop from 100 to 92 so this cause we a lot more concern so on 2 11 we go into clinic with the plan to have lab and a marrow if count were still down after the grueling hour of wait for result they come back and have tank we were so upset just hold each other cry scream shake his dr come in and discus everything w we and tell we she take the cell down straight to the lab and have they stain they immediately so we do not have to wait anymore for these agonizing result we drive home in complete shock and numbness purely expect a phone call at 7 prime minister later that night to indicate relapse but then she call and say preliminary result no leukemia cell at all we are both crumple to the floor and were so shocked a we have have anticipate the bad we make an appointment to see she next week to follow up have more lab draw and have the definitive cytogenetic and molecular test result by then so 2 17 the exact three year anniversary of his original diagnosis she walk into the room and we know immediately thing were not good even though there wa no leukemia and no blast in the marrow the cytogenetic testing come back with marker for his original leukemia inversion 16 there are no word to describe the feeling i have just two day before we have go in to my doctor and see the heartbeat of the baby on the screen we were so ready to put this disease behind we and move forward in our life but a god have will have it that is not go to happen since there wa such a minimal molecular amount of detectable disease she decide on a plan of five day of outpatient decitabine chemo follow with the sixth day of a dli we complete that yesterday ass and plan accordingly base on how he respond i am 7 week pregnant and will never understand how the good prognostic aml will not go away to relapse now is beyond devastating so now we wait

i need some encouragement right now my husband wa diagnose with stage 111 rectal cancer with lymph node involvement in 11 18 node he have surgery and they were able to remove the whole tumour he is presently receive chemotherapy 5 day on then 2 week break and is now on the second cycle after the two week break he will get radiation then one more cycle of chemotherapy due to complication during surgery he is more fragile than he would have hope but in spite of this is tolerate the chemotherapy quite well he is eat well which i am sure is help he keep up his strength i would love to hear from anyone or even well several people who have been at a similar stage a my husband even though none of we know what the future hold for we it would be encouraging to know that there is hope many thank alison

can inositol reverse damage cause by smoke a reader ask i see a report about an over the counter drug call inositol that supposedly can reverse damage to lung cell cause by smoking is this true here what we know about inositol because the risk of lung and other cancer gradually diminish after people stop smoke you can benefit from quit at any age the benefit in reduce the risk of lung cancer become evident after about five year the risk of develop lung cancer continue to decrease the long a person do not smoke but it never fall a low a the risk level of a lifelong nonsmoker preliminary report suggest that inositol a naturally occur nutrient find in certain fruit and legume may have property that can reverse cell damage in the lining of the airway in the lung one study report in the journal science translational medicine identify a pattern of gene that is disrupt by toxin in cigarette smoke that identify smoker who are at risk for cancer the study also find that inositol may turn off the gene and return precancerous cell to normal while this is potentially good news for former smoker who want to reduce their risk of develop lung cancer this wa a very preliminary study and the finding are still far too premature to be significant bottom line advice inositol is sell in supplement form at health food store but we do not recommend take it until more is know about it safety and efficacy the national cancer institute is sponsor a clinical trial of inositol and the result should provide more information in that regard from john hopkins newletter

surgeon and on april 1st have my ascend colon remove the operation go smoothly when i wake in the recovery i wa in a lot of pain but they give i some pain medicine and the pain quickly become bareable i wa move to my room all i wa able to have wa that is chip and the iv with my pain medicine under my control by press a button well a long a i do not over press the button i personally do not have to press it too much about once every 15 minute that first day my activite they want i to do wa to turn flex my ankle cough and my breathing tool april 2d i wa still only able to have that is chip they get i up and have i sit in a chair in my room about a hour later they have i walk around the ward it wa difficult to stand a straight a they want i to but i do the good a i could a i walk my belly loosne up some and i wa able to stand straighter later that afternoon i walk around the ward again thursday night i have broth and juice and italion that is they take i off the pain pump during creamy soup that is cream and jello dinner wa more soup popsicle and juice i walk around the ward multiple time on my own about midnight i get sick again saturday morning i have the same breakfast a friday morning i wa able to keep it all down i wa release saturday afternoon when release i wa on a soft diet for the rest of saturday when i get home i would nap ever couple of hour begin sunday i wa on a low residue low fiber diet sunday i feel much well than i do saturday and monday much well than sunday my daughter would take i to the mall daily so i could get my walking in doctor say no can go smoothly

http www mayoclinic org disease condition liver failure basic symptom con 20030966 sign and symptom of acute liver failure may include a yellowing of your skin and eyeball jaundice pain in the upper right area of your abdomen nausea vomit a general sense of not feel well difficulty concentrate disorientation or confusion sleepiness cause of swell in the leg http www mayoclinic org symptom leg swell basic cause sym 20050910 leg swelling cause by the retention of fluid in leg tissue is know a peripheral edema it can be cause by a problem with the circulatory system the lymphatic system or the kidney you may also experience swell due to fluid buildup after sit or stand for a long time factor relate to fluid buildup include acute kidney failure cardiomyopathy disease of heart tissue chronic kidney disease cirrhosis scarring of the liver deep vein thrombosis dvt heart failure hormone therapy lymphedema blockage in the lymph system nephrotic syndrome damage to small filtering blood vessel in the kidney pain reliever such a ibuprofen or naproxen pericarditis swelling of the membrane surround the heart pregnancy prescription medication include some use for diabetes and high blood pressure sit for a long time such a during airline flight stand for a long time thrombophlebitis a blood clot that usually occur in the leg venous insufficiency chronic leg vein with a problem return blood to the heart leg swell relate to inflammation leg swelling can also be cause by inflammation in leg tissue inflammation may be a normal response to injury or disease or it may be due to rheumatoid arthritis or another inflammatory disorder you will usually feel some pain with inflammation factor that can contribute to inflammation in the leg include achilles tendon rupture acl injury tearing of the anterior cruciate ligament in your knee baker cyst break ankle break foot break leg cellulitis a skin infection gout arthritis relate to excess uric acid infection or wound in the leg knee bursitis inflammation of fluid fill sac in the knee joint osteoarthritis disease cause the breakdown of joint rheumatoid arthritis inflammatory joint disease sprain ankle

hello my name is holly and i want to share my father story with you in january 2015 he wa diagnose with aml at the age of 49 this come a a total shock to the family a he wa healthy for all of his life after 5 intense round of chemotherapy remission and relapse and finally a bone marrow transplant i am happy to say he is now in remission he still have a long road of recovery ahead of he but he is well past day 100 of his transplant and is get strong each day i share this because i have see many story of struggle with this disease on this website but i want to remind you that recovery is possible the main goal is to stay positive that is very important for in order to win the battle a my father health is slowly improve our goal together is to visit people who are battle aml and to share his success story someone do the same thing for my family when he wa first diagnose and it make a world of difference in our approach to beat leukemia a a family member it is definitely difficult to watch someone go through this just remember cancer is not a death sentence rather it is just a change in lifestyle i hope this story will give strength for anyone who need it

hello all gosh it is been a while since i have spend any appreciable amount of time on here and once again i am remind of how much i love and appreciate daily strength early this year i discover a blog write by another young woman who is struggle with prolactinoma she have take a very non standard route in treat it i wa intrigue i know many people will be skeptical but here go anyways she use a combination of different essential oil and certain herb to treat herself she rely primarily on essential oil of frankincense and use other oil to supplement and complement it she also use certain vitamin she is very smart and have do a lot of research into the working behind prolactinoma infertility and the way essential oil work i know most people probably think of the aromatherapy craze about ten year back when they read essential oil but most of that wa just hype nice smell lotion and candle can not really heal your spirit real aromatherapy and real essential oil therapy on the other hand do seem to be back up by a lot of science recently i discover an article about an african doctor who is research the anti cancer property of frankincense essential oil turn out frankincense have very strong anti inflammatory property somehow this make it good at fight tumor i am not familiar with the science behind this bit but i have read in many place that essential oil are effective because the small size of the molecule make they able to pas the blood brain barrier brain cancer is assume uncurable because the chemical use to treat cancer in chemotherapy are not able to do this so obviously i am not a doctor and can not tell you that this will work or that you should try this instead of follow your doctor order and neither can the blog writer in other word the blog is not intend to diagnose or treat disease and neither the blog writer nor i can be hold responsible for your decision but i find it very worth investigate especially since this lady been off her med for a while have finally see her prolactin level drop from the 200s to 6 7 see her blog post on 10 21 see her headache go away her stress level fall and start have her period again check it out http ihaveprolactinoma blogspot com once you start look around you ll find that there is a lot of discussion about what make an essential oil good you can not grab the essential oil down at your grocery store you have to really research the testing and purity of the oil you want to use and make sure your distributor is reliable i am excite i have have a really hard time with my bromocriptine in recent month it seem to have build up in my system or something because i can not even take 2 5 mg in the morning without get dizzy and nauseous to the point of throw up it make i cold and numb and explain thing to i and she seem to have a comprehensive understanding of all the issue surround this disease she do not just say okay you have this disease take six pill of this per day and report back here in a month she explain how menstruation work how prolactinoma develop accord to doctor speculation and how nursing hormone and stress all play into this i would been take vitex for month but she advise i to stop i guess vitex is a tricky thing to prescribe it may or may not work depend on your individual chemistry just the right amount can help you balance your hormone but too little or too much may throw they off and make your prolactinoma worse anyways i am interested to see what you all think i hope you give the idea a chance and check out her website

with the disease the virus is know a xenotropic murine leukemia virus relate virus or xmrv some study have find that people with chronic fatigue syndrome are more likely to carry the virus but it remain far from clear whether the virus cause the disease nevertheless the red cross decide to bar people with the syndrome from donate in the interest of patient and donor safety accord to an announcement from the organization a man give blood for the red cross james a parcell for the washington post at present there are no specific federal recommendation regard deferral of individual with chronic fatigue syndrome cf or other disease that have been associate with murine leukemia virus relate virus xmrv infection nevertheless in the interest of patient and donor safety the american red cross will defer indefinitely any donor who reveal during the donor interview that they have been diagnose with cf the statement say there is currently insufficient datum to conclude that xmrv is transmit through blood transfusion however the national heart lung and blood institute nhlbi task force is conduct research to determine the frequency of the virus in the donor population whether it is transfusion transmit and whether recipient become infected and develop the disease it say a task force that review blood safety for an organization know a the aabb recommend in june that blood collect organization actively discourage potential donor who have ever been diagnose by a physician with chronic fatigue syndrome or myalgic encephalomyelitis i from donate blood or blood component in addition any donor with symptom of cf would be defer if on the day of donation they respond negatively to the question are you feel well today the agency say the recommendation come after new research strengthen the possible connection between the virus and the syndrome the red cross have implement the aabb recommendation and have go far to implement indefinite deferral for donor who reveal a history of a medical diagnosis of cf the statement say the food and drug administration which regulate blood safety have no immediate comment on the decision the agency is convene a panel of outside five myth about marijuana 1 myth marijuana is harmless truth sure it can not directly kill you but that do not mean that pot is risk free regular marijuana use have been show to be associate with long term problem include poor academic performance memory loss and lung cancer to a develop brain like those of teenager marijuana can be especially toxic use pot can lead to panic attack depression and other mental health problem not to mention increase anxiety 2 myth marijuana is not addictive truth but what you do not know is that more teen enter treatment each year with marijuana a the main substance that they abuse in 2004 64 of teen were admit for treatment for marijuana a their main drug of choice v 36 of all other substance include alcohol marijuana is addictive a it meet the criterion for substance dependence establish by the american psychiatric association include tolerance need more of the substance to achieve the same effect withdrawal symptom use a drug even in the presence of adverse effect you smoke even though bad thing have happen when you do give up social occupational or recreational activity because of substance use you quit your sport team or job because they get in the way of your drug use the desire for marijuana can have a powerful pull over a user and can make it hard to quit 3 myth marijuana is not a bad a cigarette truth nope sorry pot actually contain many of the same cancer cause chemical find in tobacco puff for puff smoking marijuana may increase the risk of cancer more than smoking tobacco do therefore if you smoke pot regularly you may experience the same breathing problem a those who smoke cigarette to put it plainly walk up flight of stair will seem difficult and if you re an athlete that unattractive wheezing and cough cause by excessive smoking will not look so hot or feel so good on the playing field 4 myth drive while high is safe than drive drunk truth hardly in a study report by the national highway traffic safety administration even a moderate dose of marijuana wa show to impair driving performance since it affect alertness concentration perception coordination and reaction time essential skill require for safe driving researcher also find that 17 1 in 5 of crash victim under the age of 18 test positive for marijuana 5 myth i can smoke pot and still get straight a truth hey anything is possible but there have been a lot of research do that state the opposite researcher have find that heavy marijuana use may be especially problematic during teen peak learn year when the brain is still develop since smoking pot can impair your ability to concentrate and retain information this can cause poor academic performance you might think you re do well in school but you ll never know if smoking pot is inhibit your true academic potential some fact you just can not argue with smoking marijuana lead to some change in the brain similar to those cause by cocaine heroin and alcohol there is 50 70 more cancer cause material in marijuana smoke than in cigarette smoke although it constantly promote a all natural marijuana smoke contain more than 400 chemical thc or tetrahydrocannabinol the primary intoxicant in marijuana and hashish is rapidly absorb by fatty tissue in various organ generally trace metabolite of thc can be detect by standard urine testing method several day after a smoking session however in chronic heavy user trace can sometimes be detect for week after they have stop use marijuana long term marijuana use can lead to addiction

hi everyone first allow i to share a little history about myself if i may i am a middle aged man and over the year i have been diagnose with gerd ibs gastritis hiatal hernia gad panic disorder tourette syndrome bi polar disorder ocd chronic sinusitis allergic rhinitis cervical arthritis with bone spur at c 4 c 5 and a few other i can not think of at the moment i have have ton of test even rare one and regularly see various specialist i have experience many bout of anxiety and depression over the year i have also fret and worry endlessly about various thing and have my share of panic attack but there are period in between where i do feel pretty good and am able to do the thing i enjoy and carry on with life anyway a few week ago i wa feel just fine and then i begin to experience the follow symptom which would wax and wane or get well or bad these symptom come on after a period of intense stress in which i have 4 5 very stressful event occur in my life lack of drive ambition motivation diminish mental clarity brain fog feeling scatter brain disorganized thought process some mild memory issue feel mentally dull retarded loopy in the head lot of anxiety lump in throat sometime feel like throat is tight feeling like i am truly lose my mind or about to die feeling like my head is empty or full of air feeling like my head is under pressure feel zombie ish space out random ache and pain in head neck and chest eye feel buggy and unfocused pressure feel for some reason these symptom almost always seem to get much bad late in the evening and at night a few time i even think i wa truly lose my mind or die i have been have fear of a brain tumor a stroke mad cow disease brain damage brain cancer dementia and so on sometimes i can be sit there and it is like my mind is just blank and it is difficult to do thing especially if they are complex and require a lot of step other time it feel like my thought are very scrambled like alphabet soup and my head is just an empty void take a sedative seem to relieve some or most of these symptom some day are well than other i would think that maybe all of this is just anxiety but the random ache and pain which are real and not imagine make i wonder sometimes i hope i have cover everything here i think i have can anyone relate to these symptom the really sad part is that all of this start just a i have begin to hello all have anyone have the experience of your cea rise after the 1st treatment of chemo my onc at stanford say before i start that it could rise on the first treatment the detail are a follow i wa dx stage 4 1 liver meet on 8 28 i have successful colon surgery and start chemo on 10 10 i do have a ct scan do on 10 9 that still show only the one liver meet it have increase in size from the 8 29 ct scan from 2 1 to 2 8 cm i am on erbitux xeloda and oxylaplatin with a schedule 3 cycle before liver surgery that is also why they do not add avastin because of the early surgery i have meet with the surgeon and tumor board at stanford a well they suggest do the chemo first to evaluate the effectiveness and protocol for post surgery chemo they also mention the effect of post surgery growth hormone release by the body follow the colon surgery and if the liver surgery wa do in oct they feel it would be in my good interest in term of prevent reoccurance to have pre surgery chemo my post surgery cea wa 10 6 on 10 2 the last blood draw have i at 17 1 after the first cycle on 10 26 obviously you want to see a downward trend over the 3 cycle but i wa not encourage any thought thank you impactzone

this article need to be look at by everybody this is awesome news grapefruit compound may help fight hepatitis c infection by david liu ph d feb 6 2008 3 23 35 prime ministerwednesday feb 6 2008 foodconsumer org a compound naturally occur in grapefruit and other citrus fruit may help get rid of hepatitis c virus accord to a study publish in an upcoming issue of the journal hematology the study lead by researcher at the massachusetts general hospital center for engineering in medicine show naringerin a flavonoid find in grapefruit block the secretion of hepatitis c virus from infected cell hepatitis c virus need to latch onto a very low density lipoprotein vldl a so call bad cholesterol to pas on the infection to other cell in the liver the effect wa observe in cultured cell line these result suggest that lipid lower drug a well a supplement such a naringenin may be combine with traditional antiviral therapy to reduce or even eliminate hcv from infected patient say yaakov nahmias phd of the mgh cem the paper lead author early study show hepatitis c virus need vldl to maintain it infection and naringenin can reduce secretion of vldl from liver cell the current study wa mean to examine whether the compound might also lower hcv secretion from infected cell the current antiviral medication can treat 50 percent of case but 70 percent are expect to develop chronic infection lead to cirrhosis or liver cancer in the end the researcher say naringerin or other lipid lower drug could be use with other antiviral medication to treat hepatitis c infection if the effect is confirm in human trial

benefit of quit smoke the follow is an editorial resource from yourtotalhealth review by timothy yarboro md no one have to tell you about the health risk of smoking after all you ve been hear about they for year from love one friend and stranger from the medium and even in that warning box on the back of each pack of cigarette you know that quit now is the single good thing you can do for your lung for your heartfor your life for many fear of illness even death is a primary motivation for quitting and that s fine the key is to find the reason to quit that mean the most to you maybe your motivator is to look well to feel well to have more jingle in your pocket consider the many way that kick the habit can kick start your life you ll soon have sweet breath your tooth will be whiter your breath fresher and you ll be le likely to develop gum disease tooth decay or tooth loss smoother skin go smoke free is one of the good way to ward off wrinkle nice nail who s yellow make those stain finger and nail a mere bad memory a sharp sense of taste remember when you could really smell and taste your favorite food you ll be able to again fresher scent your hair clothe house and car will smell well more time who do not need more time all those minute once spend on cigarette break really do add up smoker spend 8 percent of their work hour on smoking ritual the american cancer society estimate now you can spend that time get thing do more efficiently or enjoy yourself a fat wallet think of the thousand of dollar you ll save 1 600 a year on cigarette alone for the average smoker accord to the american cancer society plus more from decrease medical bill insurance premium and other cost a well feeling about yourself you ll know that you re no long expose those around you to secondhand smoke and if you have kid you can feel really good that you re set a positive example how woman and baby benefit need more reason to quit woman also reduce their risk for cervical cancer osteoporosis menstrual irregularity and early menopause thinking of have a baby consider quit smoking reduce your risk of infertility and promote a healthy pregnancy with a low risk of miscarriage premature delivery infant death and low birth weight your newborn lung function will be well too and the benefit will continue child of nonsmoker also have a low risk of sudden infant death syndrome asthma allergy ear infection cold and serious respiratory infection feel well be healthy even the health benefit of quit smoking go beyond the big picture yes it true that the american cancer society link smoke to several cancer include 87 percent of lung cancer but if these scary fact are not your good motivator focus on the more immediate benefit breathe easier cough le and have more stamen a you find it easy to breathe you can also breathe easy know that you re reduce your risk of asthma emphysema pneumonia and other lung disease a well your eye will benefit too many people are unaware that smoking contribute to eye disease such a cataract macular degeneration and diabetic retinopathy but wait there s more smoking worsens diabetic complication such a nerve damage and it may contribute to develop diabete smoking is also link to heartburn ulcer liver damage crohn disease kidney damage dementia depression anxiety and many other disorder try to prevent such condition is yet another reason to give up cigarette and your heart will thank you quit smoking is one of the good way to reduce your risk of arterial disease heart attack and stroke it also one of the good way to add year to your life

this is an exerpt from the american cancer society the full article can be find at http www cancer org cancer cancercause tobaccocancer secondhand smoke secondhand smoke what is secondhand smoke secondhand smoke is also know a environmental tobacco smoke et or passive smoke it is a mixture of 2 form of smoke that come from burn tobacco sidestream smoke smoke that come from the end of a light cigarette pipe or cigar and mainstream smoke smoke that is exhale by a smoker even though we think of these a the same they are not the sidestream smoke have high concentration of cancer cause agent carcinogen than the mainstream smoke and it contain small particle than mainstream smoke which make their way into the body cell more easily when non smoker are expose to secondhand smoke it is call involuntary smoking or passive smoke non smoker who breathe in secondhand smoke take in nicotine and other toxic chemical just like smoker do the more secondhand smoke you are expose to the high the level of these harmful chemical in your body why is secondhand smoke a problem secondhand smoke cause cancer secondhand smoke is classify a a know human carcinogen cancer cause agent by the u environmental protection agency epa the u national toxicology program and the international agency for research on cancer iarc a branch of the world health organization tobacco smoke contain over 4 000 chemical compound more than 60 of these are know or suspect to cause cancer secondhand smoke cause other kind of disease and death secondhand smoke can cause harm in many way in the united state alone each year it is responsible for an estimate 46 000 death from heart disease in non smoker who live with smoker about 3 400 lung cancer death in non smoking adult other breathing problem in non smoker include cough mucus chest discomfort and reduce lung function 50 000 to 300 000 lung infection such a pneumonia and bronchitis in child young than 18 month of age which result in 7 500 to 15 000 hospitalization annually increase in the number and severity of asthma attack in about 200 000 to 1 million child who have asthma more than 750 000 middle ear infection in child pregnant woman expose to secondhand smoke are also at increase risk of have low birth weight baby secondhand smoke may be link to breast cancer whether secondhand smoke increase the risk of breast cancer is an issue that is still being study both mainstream and secondhand smoke contain about 20 chemical that in high concentration cause breast cancer in rodent and we know that in human chemical from tobacco smoke reach breast tissue and are find in breast milk but a link between secondhand smoke and breast cancer risk in human study is still being debate this is partly because breast cancer risk have not been show to be increase in active smoker one possible explanation for this is that tobacco smoke may have different effect on breast cancer risk in smoker and in those who are expose to secondhand smoke a report from the california environmental protection agency in 2005 conclude that the evidence regard secondhand smoke and breast cancer is consistent with a causal association in young woman this mean that the secondhand smoke act a if it could be a cause of breast cancer in these woman the 2006 u surgeon general report the health consequence of involuntary exposure to tobacco smoke find that there is suggestive but not sufficient evidence of a link at this point in any case woman should be tell that this possible link to breast cancer is yet another reason to avoid being around secondhand smoke secondhand smoke kill child and adult who do not smoke and make other sick surgeon general report the 2006 u surgeon general report reach some important conclusion secondhand smoke cause premature death and disease in child and in adult who do not smoke child expose to secondhand smoke are at an increase risk of sudden infant death syndrome sid acute respiratory infection ear problem and more severe asthma smoking by parent cause breathe respiratory symptom and slow lung growth in their child secondhand smoke immediately affect the heart and blood circulation in a harmful way over a long time it also cause heart disease and lung cancer the scientific evidence show that there is no safe level of exposure to secondhand smoke many million of american both child and adult are still expose to secondhand smoke in their home and workplace despite a great deal of progress in tobacco control the only way to fully protect non smoker from exposure to secondhand smoke indoor is to prevent all smoking in that indoor space or building separate smoker from non smoker clean the air and ventilate building can not keep non smoker from being expose to secondhand smoke where is secondhand smoke a problem you should be especially concerned about exposure to secondhand smoke in these 4 place at work the workplace is a major source of secondhand smoke exposure for adult secondhand smoke meet the standard to be classify a a potential cancer cause agent by the occupational safety and health administration osha the federal agency responsible for health and safety regulation in the workplace the national institute for occupational safety and health niosh another federal agency also recommend that secondhand smoke be consider a possible carcinogen in the workplace because there are no known safe level they recommend that exposure to secondhand smoke be reduce to the low possible level secondhand smoke in the workplace have been link to an increase risk for heart disease and lung cancer among adult non smoker the surgeon general have say that smoke free workplace policy are the only way to do away with secondhand smoke exposure at work separate smoker from non smoker clean the air and ventilate the building can not prevent exposure if people still smoke inside the building an extra bonus other than protect non smoker is that workplace smoking restriction may also encourage smoker to quit in public place everyone can be expose to secondhand smoke in public place such a restaurant shopping center public transportation school and daycare center some business seem to be afraid to ban smoking but there is no proof that go smoke free is bad for business public place where child go are a special area of concern at home make your home smoke free may be one of the most important thing you can do for the health of your family any family member can develop health problem relate to secondhand smoke child are especially sensitive to secondhand smoke asthma lung infection and ear infection are more common in child who are around smoker some of these problem can be serious and even life threaten other may seem like small problem but they add up quickly think of the expense doctor visit medicine lose school time and often lose work time for the parent who must take the child to the doctor in the united state 21 million or 35 of child live in home where resident or visitor smoke in the home on a regular basis about 50 to 75 of child in the united state have detectable level of cotinine the breakdown product of nicotine in their blood think about it we spend more time at home than anywhere else a smoke free home protect your family your guest and even your pet in the car american spend a great deal of time in car and if someone smoke there hazardous level of smoke can build up quickly again this can be especially harmful to child in response to this fact the u environmental protection agency have a special program to encourage people to make their car a well a their home smoke free and some state have law that ban smoking in the car if carry passenger under the age of 17

research offer hope for liver treatmentimmune cell cause damage other repairfrom university of edinburghupdated january 06 2005about com health disease and condition content is review by the ireview boardmillion of patient suffer from liver damage cirrhosis and failure may benefit from research by the university of edinburgh and southampton which may lead to new life save treatment there is currently no cure for liver cirrhosis and a patient only hope of survival is to receive a liver transplant the edinburgh scientist from the university centre for inflammation research in collaboration with colleague from the university of southampton and cincinnati usa have for the first time identify two separate population of immune cell macrophage in the liver one group of macrophage cause scar to the liver but the next wave of immune cell produce only a few day later change function to break down and reabsorb the scar these finding publish in the january 2005 edition of journal of clinical investigation will help doctor to understand the mechanism by which the liver is damage and repaired and may lead to future treatment researcher dr jeremy duffield explain the link between the immune system inflammation and scar in the liver have not been well understand and this have hinder progress in find way to prevent and repair liver damage now that we have show how the macrophage work we before midday to find out how to create activate and de activate these cell to make they repair rather than damage liver tissue he add cirrhosis commonly but not always cause by alcohol consumption can lead to liver failure at a time when outcome for other disease such a cancer and heart trouble have make dramatic gain liver damage describe a the new plague of the 21st century have yet to be understand and in turn to become treatable more woman in the uk now die of liver failure than do of cancer of the cervix there have been a fourfold increase in the number of man age 45 54 dying of cirrhosis since 1970 and a threefold increase in woman of the same age group liver failure is also rapidly increase in young people with the death in the uk of 500 man and 300 woman age 25 44 in 2003 huge increase in liver patientsprofessor john iredale of the university of southampton say we are face a huge increase in the number of patient with advanced liver fibrosis scarring and cirrhosis end stage scar of the liver currently we have no effective treatment for liver cirrhosis which is associate with internal bleeding liver failure and the development of primary liver cancer there is a huge imperative to develop new approach to the treatment of liver scar exciting insight such a these will inform the design of future therapy further research into macrophage is set to follow and scientist will explore the role of these immune system cell in damage and repair to other organ include the kidney

the primary over the counter painkiller contain acetaminophen ibuprofen or aspirin all three of these have some impact on the liver and can cause liver damage when take in excess while occasional restricted use may be safe for those with hepatitis c a doctor will choose the drug base on which is least likely to adversely affect you 1 acetaminophen tylenol anacin 3 panadol paracetamol and other is a common mild to moderate pain reliever and fever reducer a liver afflict with hepatitis c may not be able to metabolize this drug high dose of acetaminophen can cause liver injury even to a healthy liver in limited dosage a physician will generally only suggest this class of analgesic to a person whose hepatic metabolism is fully function 2 ibuprofen motrin advil nuprin and other reduce high body temperature is an anti inflammatory and inhibit normal platelet function a non steroidal anti inflammatory drug nsaid ibuprofen can cause gastrointestinal upset and bleed those at risk of portal hypertension are already at risk for gastrointestinal bleeding intensify this risk study have demonstrate that at certain dosage ibuprofen can stress the liver and elevate liver enzyme in people with hepatitis c ibuprofen must be use with extreme caution in the later stage of liver disease and for those on interferon therapy 3 aspirin bayer anacin excedrin and other reduce fever relieve pain and act a an anti inflammatory and blood thin in addition to influence liver test result aspirin effect on blood platelet temporarily limit the clotting process and prolong bleed in chronic liver disease where the body production of clotting factor is naturally decrease aspirin can increase the risk of bleed although there is no actual drug interaction between aspirin and the drug use in interferon therapy both can disrupt blood clotting which must be monitor if use together when take in high dose more than 2 000 mg per day aspirin can cause liver injury for more info click on the link below http www hepatitis central com mt archive 2007 05 istherepainr html

my company access insight is look for patient currently suffer from hepatocellular carinoma hcc or primary liver cancer to share their opinion on their experience in deal with this disease and the consideration they have when make decision regard clinical trial such a whether they choose to take part or not there are two option for patient after qualify to participate 2 part interview a 90 minute telephone web assist interview follow by a 60 minute interview one week later and an online community with other patient the online community would require interaction with other patient at least one time per day for 1 week require at least 10 minute of your time each day ethnnography a face to face in home interview last at least 120 minute with a train healthcare moderator the interview would be follow by an online community with other patient the online community would require interaction with other patient at least one time per day for a week require at least 10 minute of your time each day patient with caregiver that are interested may see if they qualify to participate for our caregiver portion a well both patient and caregiver will receive compensation for their time and opinion once their participation in the study have complete if you are interested please follow the link i have include below if you have any question or concern feel free to contact i at 901 755 9911 and ask for kari thank you very much for your time and i hope to speak to you soon http www surveymonkey com r liverpatient

i am a radiation oncologist so i obviously get many question about all aspect of cancer i find that many patient were particularly concerned about the exact cause of their cancer and wonder whether the same cause could provoke the development of another cancer or could provoke a similar cancer for the people around they so i decide to create an application to adress those concern the before midday of the application i have develop is estimate the risk of cancer for any individual base on all the risk factor that can be find in the scientific literature it include 250 different risk factor and can calculate the risk for 26 different cancer this include lung cancer a one of the most common and well study cancer it also give you a breakdown of each of those risk by show you all the risk factor influence it both positive and negative with detailed figure possible lifestyle change one could make and reference it is completely free and do not transmit any medical or personal information to we or any other party to be clear the application is strictly educational and all information contain within can not and should not replace assessment by a physician it is aim at the general public to clarify exactly what cause cancer and give some idea which risk factor have a large or small impact the application is call cancer risk calculator and is available for both android and apple device if any of you would like to see the effect of a condition on the risk of cancer or would like to calculate your own risk please feel free to try it android http play google com store application detail i d be tdfit cancerrisk apple http itune apple com be application cancer risk calculator id1452067400 mt 8 submit to moderator before post no objection

being a total cluster even if the cdc retroviral lab do the test right if the test are not do on actual cf patient it is no good hhs coordinate xenotropic murine leukemia virus relate virus xmrv scientific activity the you s department of health and human service hhs have form an interagency scientific working group on xmrv the blood xmrv scientific research work group will report to the department blood organ and tissue senior executive council through establish mechanism no formal statement have been issue yet but the work group include representative from the dhhs office of public health and science the national institute of health nih the center for disease control and prevention cdc and the food and drug administration fda the work group will have scientific responsibility for investigation of xmrv a it relate to blood supply and cf suzanne d vernon phd the cfids association scientific director have been ask to participate in the xmrv scientific working group dr jerry holmberg of the hhs office of public health and science make a brief presentation http www cfid org xmrv blood supply oph pdf on oct 30 2009 to the dhhs cf advisory committee http www cfids org cfidslink 2009 110401 asp he describe the exist response system that address threat to blood safety such a new and emerge infectious agent like xmrv the hhs blood xmrv scientific research work group will chair by a representative of the nih national heart lung and blood institute nhlbi and will collaborate closely with the agency in charge of these system include the nhlbis retrovirus epidemiology donor study red red wa create in 1989 to address risk associate with hiv 1 hiv 2 htlv 1 and htlv 2 in the general blood supply in more recent communication with dr holmberg he state that the blood xmrv scientific research working group is take a three stage approach to it handling of the issue relate to xmrv and the possible link to human disease the first stage will be to standardize and validate laboratory method and reagent for xmrv test this is important since variation in sample collection and laboratory procedure can produce discrepant result these standardize approach will be use initially to test 1 200 healthy donor blood sample and 100 cf patient blood sample collect by dr judy mikovits of the whittemore peterson institute stage two will ass the prevalence of xmrv in the general population and blood supply a well a in other cf patient cohort the third stage will be a series of study to understand how xmrv is transmit whether it cause human disease and how it affect various subgroup of the population the immediate focus is to ascertain any risk to the general blood supply that xmrv might pose but the scientific working group is also address validation study for diagnostic test and if necessary potential blood screen test if the study indicate that screening is require for blood product blood screen test must be submit to and approve by the fda before they can be market neither of the test currently being offer by two commercial lab have been review by the fda accord to cdc their study use sample obtain from the whittemore peterson institute have hhs attention the laboratory branch in cdc division of hiv aid prevention is do the xmrv testing and not the cdc cf research group in the division of viral and rickettsial disease representative from the fda attend the xmrv meeting sponsor by abbott laboratory at cleveland clinic on nov 11 2009 dr robert silverman of the cleveland clinic give a seminar about xmrv for hhs staff on dec 2 2009 dr holmberg emphasize the need for careful application of scientific method to ensure that these study are conduct with exceptionally high rigor and reliability so that the result provide a solid scientific foundation for move forward he understand the strong interest within the cf patient community for swift action and definitive answer and express the high priority that this subject is i am write to encourage everyone with ra to get test for hepatitis c hcv it is a simple but specific blood test and you could ask your doc to do it while he is take blood for other test it have been estimate that there are about 40 000 rheumatoid arthritis patient with chronic hepatitis c infection see more at http www healthcentral com rheumatoid arthritis c 53 55491 double sthash hjtomoao dpufhcv is a virus that continually multiplie cause the immune system to constantly have to fight and it is believe that this is what trigger ra for some with hcv hcv is call a silent killer because chronic hcv is asymptomatic but it cause liver fibrosis and if untreated cirrhosis and liver cancer it is estimate that 170 million people are infect with hepatitis c in the united state the number is about 3 million see more at http www healthcentral com rheumatoid arthritis c 53 55491 double sthash hjtomoao dpufthe cdc recommend all baby boomer get test but anyone of any age could have it even if you fall into no risk group because you can get it from doctor hospital or dentist treat ra is complicate by hcv and vice versa until recently hcv wa treat with interferon but there are new hcv treatment that offer hope for cure for many with the disease so please ask your doc to test you it is a simple but specific test and anyone can have it and not know it i find out i have hcv from my rheumatologist a a result of some high liver enzyme test have ra for 35 year and likely have have hcv for 45 year

hello my sister is newly diagnose so new we have not even been to oncology yet here is what have happen so far my sister have been sick for around 10 month she have have many dr and er visit and have been diagnose with many different ailment nearly 3 week ago she wa rush to er with persistent vomiting and excruciate back neck pain this wa her 5th visit to this er and finally a dr decide to have a proper look at she we were tell that day to expect cancer at that time of the breast 5 day later we were tell she have cancer in her spine and neck secondary cancer but they were unable to find the primary at that point we were tell then it wa advanced and she probably wouldn t have too long week or month we do not realise though at that time they think she wouldn t see a week another week pas and they have discover it is ovarian cancer in her left ovary the right so far is cancer free the cancer have metastasise in her spine neck pelvis shoulder right knee and now there are lesion on her liver and lung to top it all off she have pulmonary embolic disease in her left lung that have been cause clot particle of these cause mini bilateral temporal stroke we have been tell there is no chance of survival but she go to see oncology this thursday to get more information on her cancer and to talk about chemo to slow the progression hopefully give she more time my sister throughout this have been truly inspirational she only find out the whole truth of her situation a few day ago she is far more upbeat positive and ready to fight than i could ever imagine being i am so very proud of she i am sorry this have been such a long message i am still in shock that my 27 year old sister is so sick and will be take from we probably soon than later i need to understand more about all that she is face with the cancer and the chemo thank you for take the time to read all this

colitis he give med for urinary problem and say it would knock out any colitis or infection i may have in bowel urinary problem get well about 6 week later i notice a little blood on stool again and i have start take metamucil to try and help regulate my bowel and it wa really help my stool have been float for quite some time a well i also get some flat stool when it is not a solid and soft it is form ok when solid at beginning of bm but is usually soft after that and get flat about 4 week ago i notice a little but of a feeling of something like a pull muscle in the left side of rectum never have that before it wa not all the time but notice if i push a chair in with foot or something and when pick something up off of ground just a little bit of a pull like that have get more persistent and can feel that little pull feel most of the time now this morning i go to bathroom for bm and notice a tiny speck of blood and i say enough is enough i call the dr he wa able to see i just before lunch we go over my entire history again all the way from ibs dx 20 yr ago i tell he about the feeling that feel like it is just inside my rectum on left side he push around on belly and then do a pretty thorough dre and say he feel no mass or hemmy inside which wa a relief to i he feel no mass and so on he say with my history and with no biological medical history of parent that i win the lottery of get a early colonoscopy laugh out loud i am a bit nervous of course i ask the dr what his gut is tell he and he say he think that it is probably a hemmy somewhere beyond his reach but that we should be thorough and check it all out i have not lose any weight just a history of bowel trouble mention above the small amount of blood a little mucus flat stool only when soft and the tug feel clean dre today not look for a dx but look for your thought from what i have give you i am just try not to get so worried that my ibs go crazy on i thank you all

o k so i get the test result in the mail from west valley imaging which is where i get my ct abdominal scan with and without contrast and this is the result so please help i with what these really mean do i not have cancer crohn uc or could they see those with a ct abdominal scan lung basis there is a tiny subpleural nodular opacity at the left base approximately 3 mm most likely inflammatory the lung basis are other wise clear abdoman the liver spleen pancreus adrenal gland and kidney are unremarkable the gallbladder surgically absent there is no retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy pelvis by and the uterus bladder uterus and partially opacifie bowel loop and unremarkable the appendix is normal there is no lymphadenopathy free fluid or adnexal mass bone there are no suspicious bone lesion impression 1 no acute abdominal pathology 2 tiny nodular opacity at the left base which is most likely inflammatory a follow up chest ct scan is reccommende in 12 month to document stability

hello i am new to this forum finally just have time to sign up i have been highly encouraged reading through many of your post i apologize if i do not post this in the correct area or if i should not have start a new topic but i figure this wa a good place to start i wa diagnose with aml 2 6 2016 and immediately put inpatient end up being there for 7 week 3 round of chemo and still not in remission i wa tell relatively soon in the process i have several chromosomal abnormality one i know for sure is deletion at chromosome 7 but i am not 100 sure what the other are because of these no amount of chemo will be sufficient to kill off the leukemia therefore i need a stem cell transplant thank be to god that my young brother is a perfect match match at 12 12 site yay i have been home the past few week yay just monitor my count and have my 5th bmb yesterday today we are patiently hah waiting result last bmb while i wa inpatient a few week ago show about 5 leukemic cell my transplant team have say i need to have 5 or le to proceed with transplant if 5 we need to move to plan b which could include admit for a 4th round of chemo then stay inpatient until repeat bmb 14 day after finish then do myeloablative chemo then transplant or a relatively new outpatient chemo regiman i am 32 year old a mother to my sweet beautiful 10 month old daughter and have an amazing husband who have been so supportive through all of this both of our family live relatively close to we and have been phenomenal i should also mention i am a family nurse practitioner so being on the patient side of thing have been interesting i have receive excellent care thus far and am fortunate to have access to such state of the art medical facility not too far from my home just look for other who have go through allo sct bmt and how you do through that process and how far along you are now how you are do now the nurse all tell i if i have survive 3 round of chemo each one progressively strong than i will do very well with the transplant still we all know the risk and my body is stubborn a in i have to undergo surgery to drain an abscess from my parotid gland while i wa inpatient those 7 i wa fortunate enough to be able to attend a living with lynch syndrome conference at mayo clinic in rochester mn yesterday dr henry t lynch wa a keynote speaker i have debate whether or not to go since my test result were inconclusive for lynch syndrome but the chance to meet dr lynch wa a decide factor the seminar have over twice the amount of people than the previous year so i think that other want the chance to meet dr lynch also i show he the result that my genetic counselor have send i and he say interesting he want to consult with his colleague noralane m lindor md she have make copy of my report and give they to dr lynch but i am not sure if she make a copy for herself carrie zabel the genetic counselor who put the seminar together also look at my report everyone agree that i am do what i should be at this time dr lynch have say that i wa in good hand my genetic counselor study with patrick lynch i do learn that the lynch cancer that you are succeptible to can be determine by the mismatch gene that you have and family history one of the subject wa extend resection versus colonoscopy for patient with lynch syndrome and colon cancer my primary dr have talk to my oncologist ask he to discus whole colon removal with i i have decide against it the presentation talk about segmental colectomy extend colectormy ileosigmoid extended colectomy ieorectal there were graph compare the different type of colectomie in regard to bowel movement per day incontinence quality of life outcome the conclusion were that long term bowel function and quality of life favor segmental over ileosigmoid or ileoretal that activity mood food avoidance health worry are quality of life domain impact by more extensive resection that presentation make i believe that i have make the right decision there wa a panel of individual who have lynch syndrome they share their experience one man have ureter cancer and wa diagnose with l his daughter wa diagnose with l and have a colonoscopy at 27 in which colon cancer wa find his cancer save his daughter life there were 5 different topic that you could select for break out group i choose stress management support group the support group were for survivor previvor caregiver i ride to rochester with sarah and her family i meet sarah through my genetic counselor and we sort of form an informal support group with tami i wa fortunate to hear she read a poem that she have write about dr lynch if there is a conference in your area i totally recommend attend or consider go to the conference at mayo next year

copd is the 4th lead cause of death worldwide yet 75 of those affect remain untreated this can be change the world health organisation estimate 600 million people worldwide have copd copd is project to be the third lead cause of death by 2020 with only heart disease and cerebrovascular disease account for more death lung cancer stomach cancer and hiv will be the 5th 8th and 9th most common cause of death respectively high prevalence rate for copd are find in man than in woman globally reflect historic gender difference in smoking behaviour prevalence figure for copd are believe to be underestimate sufferer tend not to seek medical advice until the disease have progress and the condition is severe quality of life qol is severely affect in patient with copd with 80 of patient hospitalise follow an exacerbation report a health status rate or quote by a physician a being bad than death an economic analysis of datum from a large scale international survey in canada france italy the netherlands spain the you k and the you sa result demonstrate lose productivity due to copd have a particularly high impact on the economy in france the netherlands and the you k account for 67 50 and 41 of overall cost respectively

hi my name is jen and i wa diagnose with aml on july 25th enter into treatment the next day go through induction fairly well no fever or infection fairly minor side affect bone marrow biopsy on day 15 show no leukemia since i wa able to stay healthy through induction wa able to go home on day 19 return to work a week later third bone marrow biopsy on day 30 still show no leukemia i will start consolidation chemo in 2 week i am not sure of all my genetic marker but i would not need a bmt which wa a huge relief a a 40 year old woman aml wa not on my radar it is been a whirlwind of emotion and a crash course in learn about the disease so far i am tolerate treatment well but realize that can change with each treatment i look forward to meet all of you i have already learn so much from read past thread thank you all for share yourself with this group

hello everyone i sign up a a member here a few month ago but never really post i always have been more of a reader than writer pretty much any question or concern i ever have i could find info for and i have get so much help just read but i have come to a point that i sure could use a little more personal encouragement understanding and lot and lot of prayer here is a brief i hope summary of my past 10 month i wa diagnose with aml august 4 2015 i wa 65 at the time now 66 my health record show diagnosis of acute myeloid leukemia with presence of erythroid hyperplasia 25 blast of all non erythroid cell normal female karyotype aml fish panel is negative molecular test show positive cebpa negative npm1 and flt3 i wa tell that i fall into the intermediate range some good marker and some not so good i receive the 7 3 protocol of cytarabine and idarubicin for induction and except for body rash from allergy to one of the med and mouth and throat problem i do very well do not really feel sick and never vomitte i wa only in the hospital for 17 day because i do so well my blood count bounce back within 3 week then i go back to the hospital for 5 day to start the first cycle of consolidation i have a total of 4 consolidation which end 1 11 2016 and i handle they with no real problem to speak of thank god a possible bmt sct wa mention by my doctor pretty early on she want i to go to scca seattle cancer care alliance for a consultation but at that time i decline and tell she i do not want a transplant just chemo only pray all the time that i would not relapse even though i have been feel so great these past month and all throughout my treatment with just being a little tired between chemos when my count go down and feel so positive strong well than i have feel in year even year before diagnosis ready to climb a mountain this summer when we go camp i recently get the news that i relapse they find a few blast in my peripheral blood and after a biopsy they find 1 to 2 blast in my bone marrow i know could still be consider remission if under 5 but the doctor say no doubt of relapse and they go by last chemo for count remission in january so that just make i in remission for 3 month which is not good for salvage chemo alone so i finally agree to go to scca for a consultation and here are my 3 choice 1 i can do nothing more and have approximately 1 year nobody but god really know 2 i can do salvage chemo only which they give i a 15 chance of long remission 3 i can do chemo tbi and a transplant lot of protocol to choose from here give i a 35 to 40 chance of long remission i have almost decide on transplant the tbi and gvhd and all the risk are weigh heavily on my mind i have such good quality of life at this point i sure hate to loose it possibly for good in a way i would like to just try the salvage chemo alone have it do at the seattle cancer center since they have access to the late and great drug that are still in the process of being approve by the fda but they are able to use they and they are have very good success with i could be one of the 15 to make it to long remission but if i do that my chance go down if i relapse again and i am not sure a transplant would be in the picture then if i wa much young i would go straight to transplant but at my age i really do not know what s good for i i know none of you can tell i what to do this is my choice alone i am just look for encouragement and prayer and whatever i decide in the near future to have a place to go where people understand what i am go through nobody can know unless they have been through it i know this is long and thank you to whoever read it it actually help to write it out i would welcome your thought good wish and prayer to everyone karen

government of canada fund peer support network for people live with hepatitis c virus where is usa apr 09 2008 10 28 et fort mcmurray alberta marketwir e april 9 2008 brian jean member of parliament for fort mcmurray athabasca and parliamentary secretary to the minister of transport infrastructure and community today announce on behalf of minister of health tony clement 13 500 for the wood buffalo hiv aid society to fund a project address the hepatitis c virus hcv epidemic include hcv hiv co infection with this funding the society will develop a peer support network to provide a supportive environment for those infect with or affect by hcv in the region hcv is a devastating but preventable disease say minister of health tony clement by reach out to at risk community and provide they with this kind of support we will be able to well address risk factor and help to promote behaviour that can reduce the risk of transmission the wood buffalo hiv aid society will build on the principle of peer base support and health promotion to increase healthy behaviour and reduce the rate of hcv transmission in fort mcmurray project activity will include the development of a formalize community network of project partner promotion of hcv prevention to increase knowledge and awareness within the community and among at risk population and the development of peer support group for those live with or affect by hcv the project will also address issue of co infection include co infection with hiv the government of canada is dedicate to build strong and healthy community say member of parliament brian jean by address hcv at the community level our government is make a difference for people here in fort mcmurray hcv is spread through contact with infected blood and cause an inflammation of the liver that can lead to cirrhosis and liver cancer approximately 250 000 people in canada are live with hcv and approximately 3 200 newly acquire infection are diagnose each year condition cause by hcv e g cirrhosis or liver cancer progress slowly and symptom may not show for year therefore approximately an estimate 35 per cent of those person live with the virus are unaware that they are infect some common risk factor for hcv infection include share needle or other drug relate equipment get a tattoo body pierce or acupuncture from an operator who do not use sterilize equipment or technique being bear to a mother with hcv being expose to infected blood in the workplace such a needle stick injury or any other incident where inflect blood come in contact with broken skin and being expose to contaminate medical equipment in part of the world where hcv is endemic share personal item like a razor or toothbrush with an infected person person who were expose to contaminated blood blood product or organ transplantation prior to 1992 may also be at risk

t18 21 while i have inversion 16 she is now two year in remission but do have a false positive pcr for over one year before it clear sure enough although my bmb wa completely clean with no sign of leukemia my pcr show positive for inversion 16 my med team state they were not concerned and i have my hickman remove oh happy day the pcr test result get more interesting a it test positive for inversion 16 sub type d and my initial diagnosis wa for sub type e this wa the first i would heard that there wa a sub type within the sub type my head wa spin but because i wa prepare for the news i wait for the rest of the story they explain that they would send a second sample to be test at the original lab that diagnose my aml they basically give no credence to the first test due to the d vice e type determination and say not to worry have a phd in worry this wa a challenge however god give i the peace that pas all understanding i honestly do not dwell on it i also avoid post here to allow our combine mourning for our precious andrea my issue is so trivial in light of lose such an amazing warrior but after some one on one encouragement from member of this group i have decide to share the happy ending to my story this tuesday i wa notify that all test come back negative no sign of leukemia and absolutely no cytogenic sign of inversion 16 praise almighty god he heal i now i have the benefit of coffee for diabetic stroke cancer parkinson kidney stone colon cancer 9 57 prime minister 0 comment new york never underestimate a cup of coffee accord to a study from american journal of clinical nutrition coffee may reduce risk of type 2 diabete the content of substance in coffee accord to they can help regulate glucose level in blood and therefore diabete wa begone a study involve hundred of patient they do whether it have a family history of diabetes or not study participant who drink five cup of coffee a day have few internal inflammation a risk factor for type 2 diabetes than those who do not drink coffee accord to a report in the journal coffee can increase the concentration of adiponectin a protein in the body that help regulate glucose the researcher speculate that drink le than five cup a day may also be useful although more study is need to support these finding at least these are preliminary finding that carry clue about the benefit of coffee for the prevention of diabetes the cover of the report twenty previous study conduct worldwide indicate that coffee reduce the risk of diabetes type 2 by 50 percent the researcher speculate that the cause is klorogenik acid in coffee act to slow the absorption of sugar in digestion chlorogenik acid also stimulate the formation of glp 1 a chemical substance that increase insulin a hormone that regulate the absorption of sugar into the cell other substance in coffee that is trigonelin pro vitamin b3 is also think to help slow the absorption of glucose this is not the first research about the benefit of coffee previous research show coffee wa also beneficial for prevent the formation of kidney stone colon cancer parkinson disease liver damage cirrhosis heart disease a well a inhibit the cognitive decline in brain power research consistently show that coffee reduce the risk of liver cancer and breast cancer coffee also protect the liver from cirrhosis particularly cirrhosis due to alcoholism coffee have also been identify to reduce the risk of stoke a study of more than 83 thousand woman over the age of 24 year show those who drink two to three cup of coffee a day have a stroke risk 19 percent low than those who do not drink coffee study on a number of man in finland show the same result a study of 4197 woman and 2820 man in france show that drink at least three cup of coffee a day can prevent cognitive decline in brain function due to age up to 33 percent in woman however the same benefit not find in man this may be because woman are more sensitive to caffeine

magical day we were marry in lake tahoe and we could not take our eye off each other during the whole ceremony i wa never so sure of absolutely want something more than i want to be his wife we were incredibly happy and act like teenager with no reservation about public display of affection we were in love and want everyone to know it ten month later ricky have a seizure at work he wa take to the hospital and an mri indicate a brain tumor he undergo brain surgery on april 4 2012 biopsy show it wa malignant glioblastoma he start radiation and chemotherapy the next month the rest of 2012 he do do not have all those year behind we but we love each other unconditionally he will always be my one great love in my heart until we see each other again deanna
