soy eater may have low rate of lung cancerpublishe november 18 2011 reutersread more http www foxnew com health 2011 11 18 soy eater may have low rate lung cancer ixzz1e4ns5u00people who eat a lot of unfermented soy product like tofu may have a small chance of get lung cancer a fresh look at past research suggest there is still no proof that soy itself is protective but compound in the soy call isoflavone have been show to slow cancer cell growth in the lab because researcher study the link between diet and lung cancer have come to mixed conclusion on soy chinese and you s scientist decide to get an overview of the medical literature they find 11 observational study a few of which follow people for a decade or long pool all of the result people who get the most soy in their diet have a 23 percent low risk of lung cancer than those who get the least accord to the american cancer society about eight percent of man will develop lung cancer at some point while six percent of woman will get the disease the new finding publish in the american journal of clinical nutrition come with several caveat accord to wan shui yang from the shanghai jiaotong university school of medicine and colleague the link between soy and cancer only hold for unfermented product such a tofu and soy milk for example what s more it wa only find in people who never smoke in woman and in asian population matthew schabath a researcher at the moffitt cancer center in tampa florida whose study wa include in the analysis caution that more research is need to tease out the relationship between soy and lung cancer it may not be soy alone schabath tell reuters health it could be a collection of other nutrient package in the food we ve been look at this for decade he add the observational study do consistently show that healthy diet will provide beneficial effect we just have not find the one magic pill that will be able to prevent this it just tell you about the complexity of this schabath say until a link is find there is one surefire way to cut lung cancer risk if you want to reduce your risk of lung cancer you need to stop smoke he say the next step is to be prudent of the information out there read more http www foxnew com health 2011 11 18 soy eater may have low rate lung cancer ixzz1e4nsfmn2i think some of we might be interested in this have an easy breathing day love holly

here is a list of abbreviation and acronym that i find invaluable when i first join a support group i know some of what they were talk about but not nearly enough i hope they help you a well 1 abg arterial blood gas this is a blood test that is give to determine a number of thing but it is the only test that is commonly use to determine the carbon dioxide content of the blood the test is usually take with a needle into the wrist area and much more difficult to do consequently it have the reputation for hurt doctor use this test to determine whether an individual is a retainer or not 2 alpha a1ad alpha 1 antitrypsin deficiency a1ad is a genetic disease of the liver and lung it result from a lack of the alpha 1 antitrypsin aat protein in a person blood which protect the lung from germ dust air pollution cigarette smoke and other inhaled irritant without an adequate supply of aat substance in the white blood cell can damage the tissue of the body in adult a1ad often lead to early onset emphysema that affect the low lobe of the lung but can also cause liver disease because a1ad is a product of genetic those that are diagnose with emphysema or copd at an early age should have a simple blood test to determine if that is the cause of their affliction if so some of the medical procedure are different in deal with the affliction 3 bipap cpap dpap per annum p stand for positive airway pressure the importance of these machine is not only that they assist in the physical need for breathing but also help remove excess co2 from the system bipap stand for bilevel positive airway pressure your bipap machine provide 2 set of pressure prescribe by your physician there is a pressure set to assist you when breathe in inspiration and when breathe out exhalation these pressure keep the airway from collapse so your lung will receive the oxygen they need bipap st work the same a bipap but also have a backup respiratory rate incorporate this mean that the machine also supply the patient with force breath cpap machine supply a set amount of positive pressurize flow through a hose connect to the nasal airway the set pressure is prescribe by your physician the ressure keep the airway from collapse relief of airway obstruction is immediate your lung will receive the oxygen they need and you will sleep much well dpap stand for demand positive airway pressure this machine will sense whether or not the patient is take a breath if the patient have not take a breath in 8 second the dpap machine will sense this and give a breath at whatever pressure flow is necessary to move the air into the lung indication for dpap usage is intolerable use of cpap 4 chf congestive heart failure simply state chf is any condition which refer to the diminished ability of the heart to carry out it function properly there are many cause and many disease which cause the condition which is much more prevalent with old folk some individual with copd find themselves afflict with condition which make they susceptible to chf 5 copd chronic obstructive pulmonary disease copd is why we are all here while some medical authority do not include asthma in the definition it is include in other and help add to the confusion of the lay person copd is actually a loosely use term by the medic these day to describe a variety of ailment include emphysema chronic bronchitis and some form of asthma it is consider a chronic and progressive which give it the awful reputation of being the beginning of the end those of we who know well realize that while there is no known cure at the present time such a cure is not out of the realm of possibility in the meantime it is prudent to do those thing that we can do to maintain a high a quality of life a is possible we can do that only through being proactive in our own medical care work in concert with our medical advisor stop smoking exercise preferably in some pulmonary rehab program and subsequent maintenance program and a number of le thing if you are interested in learn more about our disease look at our link page for the good of the good at and a listing of web page maintain by a number of our subscriber at www copd support com 6 cr can not remember stuff or any other word begin with s 7 fev1 fev1 force expiratory volume after 1 second is one of many measurement that are determine during a pulmonary function test pft the official definition say that it is the volume of gas expire after one second from the beginning of the measurement it is express in a full number which is then give a percentage base on how well a normal person of similar age sex and weight would do it is normally take a second time after use a rescue inhaler like albuterol to see what percentage of increase is obtain with medication in common usage while not totally accurate it have become to be a measure of lung function percentage for that reason you will see folk that say they have 46 lung function or 13 lung function while those number are certainly important they do not tell the whole picture because this is just one measurement in addition two people with the exact same fev1 may behave very differently one may not be able to walk to the bathroom without assistance and the other report rave result from pulmonary rehab there are a number of reference that discus the pft a good starting point would be www cystic l org handbook html pftsexplainedforyou htm or http jan ucc nau edu daa lecture pft htm 8 hepa high efficiency particulate air usually refer to a filter or mask for air filtering system air conditioner return air circulation system face mask and the sort t is of a much high rating for filtration than other system and consequently filter the air well 9 in my humble opinion in my humble opinion say what it mean i recognize that this may not be the school solution but i believe that often use by the polite to tell other that they do not know what they are talk about laugh out loud 10 laugh out loud lot of laugh or lot of love depend on context use 11 lvrs lung volume reduction surgery surgery which remove part of the lung or lung this concept use the theory that the reduction of the lung allow room for the good portion to expand and work more efficiently this is a major surgical procedure which have result in dramatic improvement for some and a reduction in lung function in other it is presently being study to determine the appropriate criterion for selection a well a evaluate improvement from pulmonary exercise a compare to lvrs this study call nett or national emphysema treatment trial is explain in detail and provide location for the center at http www nhlbi nih gov health prof lung nett lvrsweb htm 12 mdi measure dose inhaler there are many variety and brand this is just a generic description for all of they 13 o2 oxygen auxiliary oxygen use usually express a number of liter per minute hour per day day per week for example 2l 24 7 14 pcp primary care physician usually a physician who practice in general medicine or family medicine in hmo language the pcp is the doctor that is responsible for the patient care and appropriate referral 15 pft pulmonary function test a vital test for all who are afflict with any pulmonary disease a it is the real measure of the lung function and a diagnostic tool to determine the proper course of medication the test take about an hour but is non invasive primarily just breathe in a variety of tube in different way the test result include pulmonary mechanic one of which is fev1 which wa describe above lung volume diffusing capacity and other measurement include abg ph paco2 pao2 and sao2 which is a lot of gibberish which mean you should check out one of the reference on pft if you want to know more a good place to start is www cystic l org handbook html pftsexplainedforyou htm target blank www cystic l org handbook html pftsexplainedforyou htm or http jan ucc nau edu daa lecture pft htm 16 sat saturation level a determine by oximeter sometimes also call sat refer to the oxygen level which should remain above 90 when measure by oximeter or 55 60 mm hg when measure by arterial blood gas test of pao2 yep that is the thingy that they put on your finger oximeter 17 sob short of breath do we need to say more 18 positron emission tomography pet pet scan for cancer alzheimer heart disease a pet scan allow physician to measure the body abnormal molecular cell activity to detect cancer such a breast cancer lung cancer colorectal cancer lymphoma melanoma and other skin cancer brain disorder such a alzheimers disease parkinson disease and epilepsy and heart disease such a coronary artery disease pet scan are simple painless and fast offer patient and their family life save information that help physician detect and diagnose disease early and quickly begin treatment pet scanning and molecular imaging provide real life answer to well diagnose illness guide treatment option and give patient ultimate control over their critical and vital health care decision 19 of course there are a great many other abbreviation and acronym use concern our have my gi appt today the good news is that my liver biopsy and bloodwork were all negative for autoimmune hepatitis the bad news is that i have another form of liver disease call nash or non alcoholic steatohepatitis basically fat build up in the liver cause inflammation and this lead to fibrosis or scar fortunately the scarring is minimal right now but they want i on medication to prevent it from progress with nash there is a risk of it progress into cirrhosis and liver failure there are several thing that can cause it but for i the big risk factor are weight although i have lose quite a bit and the medication that i wa on for the a now i am not sure if i will be able to take those medication again i will have to discus that with they when the time come for now they will closely monitor my liver enzyme and i will have to take this medication i am also go to continue to work on diet exercise and weight reduction to avoid any further damage it is a little scary knowing that there is something go on with my liver hopefully it will just remain a is and i would not have anymore issue

hi everyone just want to post an update on jack monday wa pre trial screen for the study ucla is do the second part of this study the first part wa determine dosage the patient are randomize into three group 100 200 300 if those on the 100 do not respond well then the dosage can be increase but those on the high dose can not be decrease there are only 6 patient in the study at ucla and 230 worldwide we are bless and so thankful for this chance pre test involve echocardiogram ekg bmb dilate eye exam visual field and fundus photo my brother wa very worried about getting reject because during his last hospital stay the team discover pericarditis which can happen to long term leukemia patient eye exam demonstrate some mild hemorrhage and anemia in the eye also sign of leukemia all these result are important for baseline the coordinator np have been a saint she wa able to get everything together for a wednesday dosage jack receive a phone call to stop the hydrea that day and he receive his first dose of asp 2215 in the afternoon i have been especially busy at work and do not get to speak with he until late thursday and i wa shock he sound almost normal on the telephone he even joke with i i have not hear he like that this past year he is a very serious guy he say he have more energy but his rear end wa still slightly painful due to the abscess i want to just keep everyone up to date because i know there are several people quite curious about this trial a i wa previously there is very limited info on the result and outcome of patient when i wa look online i am hope this news will be helpful to those who are interested next appointment is monday thank you everyone for the generous support prayer and concern all of you are so awesome and strong

a genetically tweak version of a common probiotic find in yogurt and cheese appear to be an effective therapy for inflammatory bowel disease such a crohn disease and ulcerative colitis it may also prove to be useful in colon cancer another disease trigger by inflammation northwestern medicine researcher delete a gene in the probiotic lactobacillus acidophilus and feed the new form to mouse with two different model of colitis after 13 day of treatment the novel probiotic strain nearly eliminate colon inflammation in the mouse and halt progression of their disease by 95 percent this open brand new avenue to treat various autoimmune disease of the gut include inflammatory bowel disease and colon cancer all which can be trigger by imbalance inflammatory immune response say mansour mohamadzadeh associate professor of medicine at northwestern university feinberg school of medicine and lead investigator of the study he also is a member of the robert h lurie comprehensive cancer center of northwestern university the study will be publish jan 31 in the proceeding of the national academy of science while the origin of these bowel disease is not know crohn disease and ulcerative colitis are two chronically relapse disease in which sufferer have an ongoing tissue inflammation that alter the functioning of the intestine the disease affect more than 1 million people in the united state and can cause weight loss diarrhea abdominal pain and cramping and gastrointestinal bleed current drug treatment is not completely effective and patient can relapse mohamadzadeh say such gene target in a probiotic bacteria such a lactobacillus acidophilus offer the possibility of a safe drug free treatment in the near future he say in the study the modify lactobacillus acidophilus enter the gut which is akin to a battlefield of friendly fire with immune cell attack the intestine the lactobacillus acidophilus act a the gut peacekeeping force calm the overstimulated immune cell the probiotic restore intestinal peace by mobilize messenger immune cell call dendritic cell the dendritic cell in turn enhance the production of other functional immune cell regulatory t cell that rebalance intestinal and systemic inflammation they essentially calm everything down and restore it to normal mohamadzadeh explain the next step will be a clinical trial with the new form of lactobacillus acidophilus mohamadzadeh and his colleague at the lurie cancer center are currently research the effect of the new lactobacillus acidophilus on colon cancer http www sciencedaily com release 2011 01 110131153246 htm

myeologenous hypereosinophilic syndrome chronic eosinophilic leukemia m he s cel this is a type of myeloproliferative neoplasm mpn after my third bone marrow biopsy the doctor at stanford have a slightly different approach their diagnosis is systemic mastocytosis with an associated hematological non mast cell disease that is likely chronic eosinophilic leukemia sm ahnmd cel in addition to the vast number of eosinophil in my bone marrow all of the biopsy have show aggregate of spindle shape mast cell my nih doc say that the differ diagnosis are semantic apparently eosinophil and mast cell hang in the same biological circle so in the absence of specific genetic clonality it is impossible to say whether my disease is primarily eosinophilic with secondary mastocytosis or primarily mastocytosis with secondary eosinophilia welcome to the wonderful world of have an uber rare disease more than six month in and still no diagnosis when i ask my doc for any sort of prognosis they all look at each other and shrug their shoulder with the exception of say that it will eventually kill i if we do not get it under control that could be one month or five year either way we are look at this new option a a blessing despite the uncertainty we are now establish a path to get this new drug midostaurin which is a tki that have have limited success in aml patient the doctor do not want to leave i off of any treatment a my absolute eosinophil count aec continue to slowly rise last cbc i have a wbc of 27 with aec at 20 5 they start i on hydroxyurea 1 gram day to see if that would lower the count a a bridge strategy to get to midostaurin midostaurin just finish phase ii trial and is not approve by the fda novartis is the drug company and they must say yes for compassionate use a well a the fda which may take 2 month or more then another two month to see if it work my doctor who wa primary investigator on the trial is unsure if it will work but think it is worth the risk to wait to try of the 116 patient in the trial 5 present in a similar manner sm ahnmd with cel 4 of those 5 have a complete resolution of their eosinophilia additionally for those of you follow the beat aml initiative my doctor also send off my blood for evaluation with jeff tyner use the same technique for aml genome mapping with the hope that another tki might be well suit for i than even midostaurin http www ll org who we are a new approach to drug discovery src1 35591 src2 a i have become more and more versed on this subject i am more and more encouraged by the progress in beat myeologenous leukemia of all form i am fairly certain that in 20 year leukemia of this variety will be treat first with induction then tki to vastly reduce chance of relapse and then bmt only in rare occasion cml have mostly been beat replace by take a pill with few side effect we can do this too with aml i would encourage all of you out there to write your doc to send any blood that may still be store to jeff tyner and the lab if pathway exist i remember dave tell i at the beginning of this journey for i that we are all part of the process to beat this disease i take that to heart and wholeheartedly agree what i would ask of the team for i personally is to continue pray specifically for the wisdom to make the right choice between bmt and drug therapy for protection of my heart and other organ from all the eosinophil for hydroxyurea to work a a bridge strategy and for midostaurin to be approve for i and to work if you have any experience with hydroxyurea or midostaurin i would appreciate any info a milk thistle herb protect cancer patient from chemotherapy associate liver toxicity sciencedaily dec 27 2009 a new study find that the herb milk thistle may help treat liver inflammation in cancer patient who receive chemotherapy publish early online in cancer a peer review journal of the american cancer society the study indicate that the herb could allow patient to take potent dose of chemotherapy without damage their liver chemotherapy drug frequently cause inflammation in the liver and when they do doctor must often lower patient dose or stop administer the therapy altogether clinical study have investigate use milk thistle to treat liver damage from cirrhosis from alcohol or toxin such a mushroom poisoning despite limited study datum the herb is often use for the treatment of chemotherapy associate liver problem to test whether milk thistle could help treat chemotherapy associate liver problem kara kelly md of the new york presbyterian hospital columbia university medical center herbert irving comprehensive cancer center in new york city and colleague conduct a randomize control double blind study in child with acute lymphoblastic leukemia all who commonly experience this side effect fifty child with all were enrol in the study and were randomize to receive milk thistle or placebo for 28 day at the start of the study all of the child have evidence of liver inflammation a measure by elevation in blood level of the liver enzyme aspartate amino transferase ast and amino alanine transferase alt when the investigator perform liver function test on the child at day 56 28 day after receive the herb or placebo child receive milk thistle have improvement in their liver enzyme compare with child receive a placebo specifically the group that take milk thistle have significantly low level of ast and a trend towards significantly low level of alt take milk thistle also seem to help keep few patient from have to lower the dose of their medication chemotherapy dose were reduce in 61 percent of the group receive milk thistle compare with 72 percent of the placebo group in addition milk thistle appear to be safe for consumption the researcher also study the effect of combine milk thistle with chemotherapy on leukemia cell grow in the laboratory they find that milk thistle do not interfere with the cancer fighting property of chemotherapy milk thistle need to be study far to see how effective it is for a long course of treatment and whether it work well in reduce liver inflammation in other type of cancer and with other type of chemotherapy say dr kelly however our result are promise a there are no substitute medication for treat liver toxicity

i have not post an update for quite some time but think it might be valuable for someone on this site to hear my late and hopefully find that they fit the criterion for a phase 1 trial that i am being consider for a a few of you know 3 year since my original surgery and treatment my ec have appear for the third time it is in two location in my abdomen with a suspicious spot on my liver and have been restage at stage 4 i can not have any more radiation the location are inoperable so chemo to try to control it is the only option i have minimal symptom so far and so have decide not to be treat for at least another couple month i have been able to stay very active daily exercise camp 57 night this year already sail kayaking and so on at my last visit to md anderson cancer center they get my permission to evaluate my biopsy and dna for a possible phase 1 trial for a drug call amg337 the drug company amgen have pay the extensive cost of the testing and i am currently await the result there is a chance i fit the criterion for the trial in which case the drug company will pay all relate cost my understanding is that they are look for a specific mutation that have to do with receptor that are part of the cancer cell and seem to occur with esophageal and other gastro type cancer the side effect of the drug it is a pill are apparently very tolerable well than chemo and result on the few of those who fit the specific criterion have been substantial significantly reduce size and or elimination of detectible cancer hopefully if there are any of you in a similar situation a mine your doctor may be able to check on this phase i trial and that it will help someone feel free to contact i if you would like more information about the contact at mda in houston

hospital it wa difficult to develop a relationship with any one consultant or the ever change team of doctor and nurse and when some of the doctor do stop long enough to answer our many question differ opinion add confusion my husband survive the initial aggressive induction but we were totally unprepared for the period of neutropenia that follow it he wa very sick and express that the treatment would probably kill he before leukemia do three considation treatment follow and each time his recovery become more difficult and dehumanising in cr by that time my husband decide not to have a 4th consolidation a recommend by his consulting oncologist who have manage his case at the hospital op clinic my husband wa bless with 15 month in remission i stop work so that we could live life to the full knowing that the prognosis for people over 60 is not positive and that the cancer could return anytime richard decide that when that time come he would not undergo a second induction and would choose palliative therapy he want to die with dignity and not in a hospital from the toxic side effect of chemical and neuropenia on 23 november 2008 follow a rountine blood check we become accutely aware that something wa not right the consultatant wa nearly 2 hour late for our appointment my husband wa anxious and impatient and complain about the wait when the consultant finally do arrive he berate my husband a if he were a child and say you have to learn to suck this up if you do not then i would not be your consultant anymore he then procede to tell we the bad news and order my husband immediate admission into hospital we decide to go home and think about what to do next and to spend thanksgive with family i still do not know why my husband change his mind about not undergo a further induction but he do this time even more aggressive than the first they call it salvage chemo like clean up after a wreck but none of the doctor could tell we what would happen after this because the outcome are unpredicatable and different for each individual nine day later on 11 12 08 my husband heart stop beat that morning he have been tell that he have contact clostridium difficile despite all the antibiotic antifungal and antiviral medication he have been receive post chemo and that this wa what wa make he so sick he wa admit to the icu where he die in the early hour of 12 12 08 follow a second mi richard have no history of heart problem and an ekg prior to start chemo wa normal the percentage of blast in his bone marrow were just 23 prior to start chemo what i am really struggle with is whether my husband death wa a good death what would have happen if he have follow a supportive or palliative option rather than the empiric treatment could he have leave this world in a more gentle way at home or hospice do anybody have story to tell that might answer these question and perhaps offer a hopeful alternative to people whose prognosis is not a good a say a young healthy person nothing can bring back my beloved husband but i have a need to know a part of contain my grief and understanding well the treatment choice for this terrible disease

month here is always fill with the smell of wood burning and it always effect my breathe the study below is no suprise but i think i would pas it along breath easy everyone always hug holly http scienceblog com 36495 wood smoke exposure multiplie damage from smoking increase risk of copd wood smoke exposure multiplie damage from smoking smoker who are expose to wood smoke either through home heating and cooking or through ambient neighborhood pollution are not only at increase risk of copd but are also more likely to have epigenetic change in the dna that far increase their risk of copd and relate pulmonary problem together smoke wood smoke exposure and these epigenetic change can increase an individual risk of copd fourfold when cigarette smoker are expose to wood smoke their risk of have reduce lung function increase explain lead author yohanne tesfaigzi ph d senior scientist and director of copd program at the lovelace respiratory research institute where the research wa complete cigarette smoker who have both change in sputum dna and are expose to wood smoke have a synergistically increase risk of have reduce lung function and other indicator of copd such a chronic mucous hypersecretion the research wa publish online ahead of the print edition of the american thoracic society american journal of respiratory and critical care medicine dr tesfaigzi and colleague administer questionnaire to more than 1800 current and former smoker between 40 and 75 year old and obtain demographic and smoke exposure information a well a sputum sample which were analyze for epigenetic change to eight gene know to be associate with lung cancer they find that wood smoke exposure wa significantly and independently associate with an increase risk of respiratory disease especially among current smoker non hispanic white and man furthermore wood smoke exposure wa associate with specific copd outcome in people who have aberrantly methylate p16 or gata4 gene and both factor together increase the risk more than the additive of the two risk factor together they also find that people with more than two of the eight gene analyze show methylation were also significantly more likely to have a low than predict fev1 than those with few than two methylated gene because exposure to wood smoke appear to increase the risk of reduce lung function cigarette smoker should try to avoid heat their home or cook with wood stove and try to avoid environment where wood smoke is likely for example neighborhood where wood smoke is common say dr tesfaigzi because the same gene change were associate with increase risk for lung cancer one would assume that wood smoke exposure also increase the risk of develop lung cancer future study may show that it would be appropriate to screen patient for lung cancer if these exposure were present for prolong period base on these finding dr tesfaigzi and colleague establish an animal model that will be able to far test whether both wood and tobacco smoke exposure cause more damage to the lung than either one of the exposure alone we observe increase inflammatory response in mouse that were expose to both cigarette smoke and low concentration of wood smoke compare to those expose to cigarette smoke only we would like to use this animal model to determine the mechanism underlie this exacerbation say dr tesfaigzi because wood smoke exposure wa document by self report and wa not quantify in this study in the future dr tesfaigzi also intend to characterize the type and amount of wood smoke the participant were expose to such study will help to far refine the analysis and provide intervention strategy

for some food lover there is nothing more delightful than eat sweet pepper lavishly stuff with ground beef saute onion tomatoe wild rice and bake with a tasty home make tomato sauce this age old to give interesting colour sequence like green turn orange brown turning red or green turn purple the inside of the thick flesh of the sweet pepper is an inner cavity with edible bitter seed and a white spongy core the seed and the core should be remove during food preparation although call pepper bell pepper are not hot a they contain a recessive gene that eliminate capsaicin the compound responsible for the hotness find in other pepper www whfood com versatility the versatility of the green pepper is unmatched especially because of it delightful slightly watery crunch green and purple pepper have a slightly bitter flavour while the red orange and yellow one are sweet and almost fruity pimento and paprika are both prepare from red bell pepper bell pepper are use for soup salad casserole and entre there is nothing more tantalising to the taste than caramelise bell pepper grill or oven roast to perfection selection bell pepper a warm weather fruit should be carefully select pepper should have a deep vibrant colour and firm skin with fresh looking stem they should not have soft spot blemish or darken area healthy pepper should be heavy for their size and firm enough that they will gently yield to slight touch health benefit we know that colourful food on a plate provide a good range of mineral and vitamin so important for maintain health bell pepper ideally fill the bill for colour versatility and excellent health protection protect against free radical bell pepper are rich in two powerful antioxidant vitamin c and vitamin a vitamin a come through it concentration of carotenoid such a beta carotene these antioxidant work together to effectively neutralise free radical which can travel through the body cause radical damage to cell the build up of cholesterol in the artery is due to free radical a the build up of cholesterol increase it lead to atherosclerosis and heart disease nerve and blood vessel damage in diabetic the cloudy lense of cataract the joint pain and damage associate with osteoarthritis and rheumatoid arthritis and the wheezing and airway tightening of asthma bell pepper provide two potent free radical destroyer reduce the risk of a range of disease reduce risk of cardiovascular disease sweet pepper also contain vitamin b6 and folic acid two important b vitamin which reduce high level of homocysteine a substance produce during a biochemical process which form part of the methylation cycle the risk of stroke atherosclerosis and diabetic heart disease is increase by high homocysteine level which may cause damage to blood vessel in addition to provide the vitamin that convert homocysteine into other beneficial molecule bell pepper are also rich in fibre that can help chip away at high cholesterol level another risk factor for heart attack and stroke prevent cancer with increase in the rate of prostate cancer red pepper are one of few food that contain lycopene a carotenoid know to be effective in treat prostate cancer and cancer of the cervix bladder and pancreas study suggest that individual whose diet are low in lycopene rich food are at great risk for develop these type of cancer for people worry about colon cancer the fibre find in pepper can help to reduce the amount of contact that colon cell have with cancer cause toxin find in certain food or produce by certain gut bacteria in high fructose corn syrup link to liver scar march 18 2010 physorg com high fructose corn syrup which is link to obesity may also be harmful to the liver accord to duke university medical center research we find that increase consumption of high fructose corn syrup wa associate with scar in the liver or fibrosis among patient with non alcoholic fatty liver disease nafld say manal abdelmalek md mile per hour associate professor of medicine in the division of gastroenterology hepatology at duke university medical center her team of researcher at duke one of eight clinical center in the nonalcoholic steatohepatitis clinical research network look at 427 adult enrol in the network they analyze dietary questionnaire collect within three month of the adult liver biopsy to determine their high fructose corn syrup intake and it association with liver scar the researcher find only 19 percent of adult with nafld report no intake of fructose contain beverage while 52 percent consume between one and six serving a week and 29 percent consume fructose contain beverage on a daily basis an increase in consumption of fructose appear to be correlate to increase liver fibrosis in patient with nafld we have identify an environmental risk factor that may contribute to the metabolic syndrome of insulin resistance and the complication of the metabolic syndrome include liver injury abdelmalek say research abdelmalek publish in the journal of hepatology in 2008 show that within a small subset of patient high fructose corn syrup wa associate with nafld her late research publish online in hepatology go one step far and link high fructose corn syrup to the progression of liver injury non alcoholic fatty liver disease is present in 30 percent of adult in the united state abdelmalek say although only a minority of patient progress to cirrhosis such patient are at increase risk for liver failure liver cancer and the need for liver transplant she explain unfortunately i see many ask about blood test and the importance of they i really like find this piece i clip out of and article a it simplify the explanation of different blood test to find out what is go on in your liver by burton m berkson md miss phd in my opinion there are four laboratory test that really tell a doctor what is go on in the liver the first is the platelet count it is important because a liver inflammation and scar progress the platelet count go down so the platelet count is a very helpful indirect indication of liver health and a rise in platelet count is and indication of a healing liver i believe that the albumin level is the most important liver function test a diseased liver can only produce a small amount of albumin so a person with severe liver disease have a low albumin level and a the liver improve the albumin level rise the alt is a liver enzyme that result from damage to the liver it normally go up and down from day to day however a downward trend may suggest an improvement of liver function interestingly enough in case of severe liver disease the alt is very low because most liver cell have been kill off the prothrombin time is a very important tool for measure liver health because a sick liver can not produce much of the clotting factor and this the prothrombin time a time it take the blood to clot is elongate in severe liver disease a the liver regenerate the prothrombin time shorten

hi thank to everyone here for being so open and generous about share their own experience of pe i have spend many hour read your post and it have been so helpful i leave hospital 2 week ago shock bewildered and more than a little bit frighten my story of a pe start in the middle of january i have an apparent chest infection pain in shoulder and lung and pleurisy on chest xray antibiotic and painkiller follow i miss 2 day work take a 2 hour flight and wa get on with thing however the pain in my lung come and go though i stop cough blood i do not feel right for many week i struggle to work full time and in the evening have no energy to play with my young child almost six week later the symptom return this time on the other lung i feel like i have a virus and the pleurisy symptom were back but much bad this time my doctor diagnose a viral illness but give antibiotic just in case about a week in to this episode i suffer horrific pain in the effected lung and shortness of breath i cough more blood and the pain recede it wa night time and i could not face the er i return to work two week after become unwell i still feel unwell with intermittent pain in both lung but only mild and transient sob my doctor have tell i to get a repeat chest xray after 6 week but by now i feel there wa something very wrong with i lung cancer wa top of my list i have the repeat xray after 3 week and go to a lung specialist the follow up xray wa clear on both side the pleurisy wa go but i wa still in discomfort he reassure i it wa not lung cancer and concur with my regular doctor it wa probably viral however he organise for blood include a d dimer just to be sure i have the test a week later when feel very unwell sore throat and so on two day later he ring i it wa elevate and he order a v p scan a clot show up on one lung the other one the first one with pleurisy wa clear in shock i wa admit to hospital to start treatment and further test no clot were find on my leg i am try to understand how all this happen i am 42 female with no risk factor i am very worried that this clot or clot if i have maybe have one already is a sign of malignancy i see that this have been a concern for other on this site too i am go to have a few more test concern malignancy but it will be a few month and i am find the uncertainty hard to manage i would be grateful to hear how other have manage this and also what follow up test you undergo many thank
